intro: Ditassa mucronata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has a short, thick stem with fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Its flowers typically bloom in clusters and are known for their vibrant hues and long-lasting appearance. The plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
